name: Overview
main:
Almost half of the population is need of assistance. Conflict has resulted in displacement, targeted killings along communal lines, and human rights abuses. Protection, humanitarian access, and food security are priority needs.. Needs continue to exceed available resources, and delivery of aid is expected to continue to decline because funding remains low. 

Since November 2016, fighting among ex Seleka in central CAR has resulted in large numbers of displacement, as well as access and protection concerns. Fighting is moving south, with significant clashes reported in Haute-Kotto, Basse-Kotto, Haut Mbomou, and Mbomou in May.

INFORM measures CAR's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be extremely high, at 8.4/10. CAR's vulnerability is of particular concern.?
latest_developments_past:
28/06: 40-50% of houses in Bria have been destroyed following ongoing fighting since May. Shelter are needs are high as it is currently the rainy season.?

22/06: Essential water distribution to IDPs disrupted after fire due to conflict in Bria.?
